oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WATER FLOW MODELLING OF THE VENICE LAGOON
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Marchi, Enrico
Adami, Attilio
Caielli, Alfredo
Cecconi, Giovanni
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: flow modeling
Venice Lagoon
lagoon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The paper describes the relevant set of analogical, mathematical and phisical models used to simulate the hydrodynamics phenomena of the Venice lagoon. The various models are devided in two classes, depending on the scale: the great scale models, to examine the problems interesting the entire lagoon, and the little scale models for the problems localized near the inlets, where the barrages will be built to control the lagoon water level.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
